page.title: 04Education In Dymchurch 1
page.content: There are 2 play-groups in Dymchurch. The group at the Church Hall run by Mrs Rice has 25 pupils between 2 & a half & 5.They go for 3 hours a morn- ing.The parents pay 70p a day.They learn the alphabet and to write their names.They play in a sand-pit,with a rocking-horse & tricycles. There are 131 children in Dymchurch Infants School aged 5 - 7,33 in each class.They have 5 teachers including the headteacher.There is a mid-day supervisor for each class.2 kitchen ladies serve dinners.The children learn handwriting,language,reading, number,cooking,painting,P.E.,swimming & clay-modelling.There are 2 extra-curricular clubs:recorder play- ing & country dancing.In the after- noons the children learn through play. They play mums & dads in a playhouse, dress up & have toys & games.
